description.en: The course is divided into 5 subprojects. Every project will start with the in silico design of the genetic circuits to be built with the aim to gain the desired biological function. This stage will be held separately, few weeks before the laboratory stage, during the course "LTTI.00.016 Bioinformatics for Bioengineers", in order to order the synthetic DNA and other missing reagents. Each student will participate in at least three different projects. The list of the projects is subject to changes in each year depending on the progress and emerging new ideas. Four main biological systems used in synthetic biology will also be used in the course: bacteria, yeast, plants and mammalian cells.
description.et: Praktikum on jaotatud  viieks alamprojektiks. Iga projekt algab geneetiliste signaalivõrgustike in silico disainiga, mille eesmärgiks on luua uus bioloogiline funktsioon. See esimene etapp viiakse läbi eraldi, mõned nädalad enne kursuse laboratoorse osa algust, teoreetilise kursuse "LTTI.00.016 Bioinformaatika biotehnoloogidele" raames, et oleks aega tellida sünteetilne DNA ja vajaminevad reagendid. Iga üliõpilane osaleb vähemalt kolmes alamprojektis. Projektide nimekiri muutub igal aastal vastavalt arengule ja uute ideede esilekerkimisele. Kursus sisaldab alamprojekte, milles kasutatakse kõiki nelja peamist sünteetilises bioloogias kasutatava organismi: bakter, pärm, taim, imetajarakud.

objectives.en: The course will provide the students hands-on experience on a wide variety of laboratory techniques and protocols used in synthetic biology. Most importantly, the course enhances creative thinking for the design of biological systems with novel functions. In this process, the students will learn how to combine the building blocks of genetic circuits and protein modules, seeds the engineering attitude for biological design. It also combines techniques from different disciplines, including electronics, biosensors, sustainable energy and bioprocessing, organic synthesis etc. Another goal of the course is to start with the Build-a-Genome Project planned during the Module 3 of the course "LTTI.00.016 Bioinformatics for Bioengineers".
objectives.et: Praktikum annab üliõpilastele praktilise kogemuse erinevate sünteetilises bioloogias kasutatavate laboratoorsete meetodite ja protokollide rakendamise osas. Peamiselt arendatakse loovat mõtlemist sünteetiliste bioloogiliste süsteemide disainimisel. Selle protsessi käigus õpitakse nii teoreetiliselt kui praktiliselt konstrueerima geneetilisi signaalivõrgustikke ja valgumoodulite aluselemente. Selline lähenemine ärgitab kasutama insenerimõtlemist bioloogiliste süsteemide kontekstis. Samuti kombineerib praktikum meetodeid erinevatest distsipliinidest nagu näiteks elektroonika, biosensorid, jätkusuutlik energia ja biotöötlus, orgaaniline süntees jne. Kursuse lõppeesmärk on alustada sünteetiliste kromosoomide projektiga, mille plaan koostati samal semestril toimuva kursuse "LTTI.00.016 Bioinformaatika biotehnoloogidele" kolmanda mooduli käigus.

learning_outcomes.en: The aim of the lab is to guide the students through the entire creative cycle required for the design of synthetic biological systems with novel functions. The participants will go through all stages of the design-build-test process followed by analysis and interpretation of the outcome. The students acquire basic molecular biology skills and gain an experience in which they take ownership of their projects, troubleshoot their own experiments, present at frequent laboratory meetings.
learning_outcomes.et: Praktikumi eesmärk on juhatada üliõpilased läbi sünteetiliste bioloogiliste süsteemide disaini loomingulise tsükli. Proovitakse läbi kõik disain-konstrueerimine-testimine protsessi etapid, millele järgneb tulemuste analüüs ja interpreteerimine. Kursuse läbimise järel valdab üliõpilane mitmeid molekulaarse kloonimise  ja eksperimentaalse rakubioloogia alustehnikaid ja tunneb bioloogilise materjaliga töötamise reegleid. Samuti oskab üliõpilane disainida sünteetilise DNA järjestusi ja omab praktilist kogemust kromosoomi konstrueerimises.

1. 6 test in Moodle completed

Pass Yeast Synthetic Biology part (67% of Course Total)
Pass Plant Synthetic Biology part (33% of Course Total)

name.en: Centre for Genomics, Evolution and  Medicine

description.et: Introduction to the course, course regulations, grading system. Theoretical background: PCR method, types of PCR, required components of the PCR reaction. Practical part: PCR amplification of the estradiol transcription factor (Estr-TF) with and without the addition of a 3HA-tag. DNA extraction from E.coli turbo cells of the backbone plasmid pRG205MX-p7tet.01-tcyc1. Measurement of DNA concentration with Nanodrop. Gel electrophoresis after PCR, cutting out the correct DNA fragments.

Practical session: DNA purification from agarose gel. Restriction enzyme digestion of the backbone plasmid and purified PCR products. Gel electrophoresis of the restricted plasmid, cutting out correct DNA fragments from the agarose gel. Ligation reaction of the backbone plasmid and PCR products.

Theoretical part: Bacterial transformation, discussion of the method, required conditions, applications in molecular cloning. Practical part: Bacterial transformation (E.coli turbo strain) with ligated DNA fragments.
Practical session: DNA extraction from bacterial cells. Restriction analysis of the purified DNA. Sanger sequencing: samples and form preparation.

Practical session: Preparation for the Golden Gate assembly. PCR amplification of TetR, p7tet.01, pEstr. Plasmid DNA extraction from bacterial cells (miniprep) of pYTK001 entry vector for Golden Gate. Agarose gel electrophoresis of PCR products. Cutting out the correct DNA fragments from the agarose gel.

Theoretical background: Yeast transformation. Integrating, autonomously replicating plasmids for yeast transformation. Practical session: Analysis of the Sanger Sequencing results using Benchling software. Selection of the correctly assembled plasmids. Yeast transformation, method discussion, required conditions. S.cerevisiae transformation with plasmid DNA. Golden Gate with pYTK001 and purified PCR products.
Practical session: Yeast colony check PCR. Agarose gel electrophoresis with PCR products. Bacterial transformation with plasmids assembled via Golden Gate reaction.

Practical session: Plasmid extraction from bacterial cells (pYTK001 + PCR products). Restriction analysis of the purified plasmid DNA. Sanger sequencing of correctly assembled plasmids (pYTK001 + PCR products).  Golden Gate reaction setup to assemble transcriptional units.
Practical session: Bacterial transformation with assembled transcriptional unit plasmids.
Practical session: Transcriptional unit plasmids extraction from bacterial cells. Restriction analysis of the purified plasmid DNA. Golden Gate reaction to assemble multigene cassette plasmids.
Practical session: Bacterial transformation with assembled multigene cassette plasmids.
Practical session: Multigene cassette plasmid extraction from bacterial cells. Restriction analysis of the purified plasmid DNA. Yeast S.cerevisiae transformation with plasmid DNA.

Practical session: Yeast colony check PCR. Agarose gel electrophoresis with PCR products. Selection of positive yeast colonies. Discussion of the course experiment, time-lapse fluorescence microscopy, Western blotting.
Practical session: Time-lapse fluorescence microscopy, fluorescent signals detection from induced yeast cultures.
Western blot. Part 1

Plant Synthetic Biology Part:

Agroinfiltration in Nicotiana benthamiana with vectors for expression of fluorescent proteins in various cellular compartments. Stable Arabidopsis transformation.

Plant Synthetic Biology Part:

Confocal microscopy imaging of transformed N. benthamiana leaves. Results of plants selection on herbicides.

Plant Synthetic Biology Part:

Experiments with genetically-encoded fluorescent sensors. Group 1.

Plant Synthetic Biology Part:

Experiments with genetically-encoded fluorescent sensors. Group 2.

Plant Synthetic Biology Part:

Experiments with genetically-encoded fluorescent sensors. Group 3.

Plant Synthetic Biology Part:

Final test on Plant synthetic biology part

audience.et: Only for 2nd year Science and Technology bachelor students, specialising in Bioengineering and Robotics !
